intro: Geleznowia, commonly known as the snowbell tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Kazakhstan and Mongolia. The plant is characterized by its deciduous nature, with small, bell-shaped white or pale yellow flowers that appear in early spring. Its leaves are typically small, elliptical, and arranged alternately along the stems. Geleznowia species are often found in rocky or well-drained soils, thriving in cooler, high-altitude environments.
